summary: H.R. 259, the "No Funding for Illegal Migrant Billboards Act," proposes to amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002. This bill would prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from obligating or spending any federal funds to advertise the office or functions of the Immigration Detention Ombudsman to the general public. The prohibition explicitly includes billboards but is not limited to them, effectively ending public awareness campaigns about this particular office. The bill was introduced by Representative Andy Biggs of Arizona and referred to the Committees on the Judiciary and Homeland Security.
